Reviews.Title: Nice little camera once you go through the manual set up!
Reviews.Author: LisaLisa "kldckldc"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: 12/03/13.  Upgraded to FIVE STARS now.Although I noted that I'd provide an update in 30 days...it just hasn't been worth my time as I'd disconnected the IZON camera for a while.  This product was definitely hit-or-miss.  Three weeks ago, we got a new router for our home wireless system.  I finally found time over the weekend to try to set up the camera again.USE THE MANUAL SET-UP PROCESS.....When it WAS working previously in the summer, and we would check the camera when away from home, invariably we would get a black camera screen, or a frozen video screen with "network congestion" as a regular message.  I'm not sure what network congestion was there when no one was at home, so...that's one of the reasons I disconnected the camera.  No point in having it on if it's not providing a clear readable image.Since we got a new router, I thought that might resolve the problems, and it did.  We had a D-Link router and now we have an ASUS router.  Started to try to set up and connect via my iPhone.  The message was "Number of Bonjour retries exceeded."  So I switched to my iPad for setup.  Went through the "manual set up" and that seems to have worked just fine.  The firmware updated so that was a bit of a delay to get up and running.  It's working now.The camera works great over wifi, too, which I tested today while shopping at The Home Depot over their public wireless system.  The sound is also working well.  This is great since we just adopted a dog and we want to keep tabs on him remotely even when we are outside in the yard or upstairs from his "den."I now would definitely recommend this product to Apple product users.+++++++++Bought one of these cameras to use with my iPhone.  Wanted to use it at home for security purposes.Took forever to get it to set up with my home wireless network.  Like another reviewer, I went through the exact same process many times.  Finally on the 10th try, the camera was working.  Just seems that the process takes a lot longer than 10 minutes to set up, so be patient.Once I got the camera up and running through the regular setup process, it added another "instance" of what appeared to be the same camera on the iPhone app, which it then tried to register, and both were somehow deleted.  The "register" process seemed to hang a lot.  So, I started over.  Again.  And this time I went through the "Manual Setup" process -- three times before it actually worked.MANUAL SET UP WAS THE KEY!The help guide that's located on the IZON app isn't the same as the one on their website.  Also, the steps are not the same.  The online version is far more comprehensive.  I find that to be a huge issue with product companies.  (Do you really think customers will give your product a great rating if it takes hours of repetitive steps and Googling on the Internet to get it set up?)  The suggestion to disconnect your home wireless router was silly because the app will tell you that you need to have an active wireless connection to set up the camera.  If the app crashes, it will ask to send a report back to STEM.  Each time I got a response back from the STEM Help Desk, it was the exact same set of instructions which were not working.  Being the stubborn IT professional that I am...I was sure going to figure this out by myself!  And I did.Once I got the camera up and running, it did exactly what I needed.  I can view from my iPhone 5 and iPad while on my home wireless network, and can also view while on 4G or LTE service through AT&T.;I'm probably being very kind by giving 3 stars considering the time it took me to set up and the constant crashing of the iPhone app and "network congestion" errors (is that MY network or is it the Internet?).Although the IZON iPhone app crashes very often, the iPad app seems to be working better.  The camera appears to drop from my wireless network every now and then.BE AWARE that the camera has a microphone on it and picks up sound pretty clearly.  If you have the camera on constantly and are pointing it out a window to watch the wildlife outside, like I am, be aware that it is still picking up sound in the room whether you are wanting to monitor sound or not.  That's ok with me unless someone nearby could access it and listen in to the conversations inside our house.  Just a note of reminder to those of you not wanting to monitor sounds.I will provide an update within a month.  I can't recommend this product at this point.  So THREE STARS it is for now.

Reviews.Title: Needs some work
Reviews.Author: Happy Cooker
Reviews.Content: I bought this one after the three month old In-Sight by Phillips failed to send notifications to our iPhone 4S.  The Izon View was a bugger to install.  After spending about 5 or 6 hours on it, I finally got it working.  I installed the app on the iPad 3, too, and it would send notifications to it but not to the iPhone 4S so I deleted it from the iPad as it's not the one I carry around with us.After reading the reviews here, thought some of you might find this response from Stem Innovation helpful if you have trouble with the installation."Thank you for contacting Stem Innovation!We suggest installing your IZON manually by following the instructions below:1) First, unplug the IZON, wait 10 seconds, and plug the IZON back in.2) Reset your IZON or IZON VIEW by following the instructions below:a) Insert the tip of a paperclip into the pinhole on the BACK of the IZON until you feel a soft `click'. Hold in this position for 10-15 seconds until the LED light inthe front of the camera turns off for a few seconds. The light will then turn on and show a quick, alternating ORANGE and GREEN pattern. Please keep inmind that the alternating ORANGE and GREEN pattern could last for several seconds. *WARNING: DO NOT insert anything in the pinhole on the FRONT ofthe camera (this is the microphone port) as it may damage your IZON VIEW and void your warranty.b) The LED light will then turn solid ORANGE. This will complete the rebooting process. Please keep in mind that the light could stay solid ORANGE for a fewminutes. The LED light will then start blinking one of the following blinking patterns depending on the firmware version of the IZON or IZON VIEW:IZON 1.X: Blinking ORANGE and GREEN (in this case, you need to perform the manual setup and please update your firmware)IZON 2.0.2: Blinking ORANGE patternIZON VIEW 3.0.2: Blinking intermittent ORANGE ORANGE and GREEN GREENIf this is not successful on your first try, go through the above steps again. The LED patterns MUST follow this sequence in order to be reset properly.3) Return to the Stem app and click `Add Camera' under the `IZON Cameras' section. A new screen will appear. Choose the IZON or IZON VIEW depending on yourspecific camera.4) A new screen will appear saying: "IZON will be installed on your network named: (your Wifi password)". Click on the 3rd button called 'Manual Setup' (instead of the'continue' button).5) A Manual Setup message will appear saying, "This process should be used if QR Code discovery is not successful, or if the camera blinking pattern is alternatingorange and green." Press `Continue'.6) Follow the instructions as prompted by the app to complete the Manual Setup:a) Switch to the stem network by going to the settings app on your iOS device. Under Wifi, connect to the STEM network. Return to the Stem app and click`Continue' in the top right corner.b) An image of the camera view should come up within several seconds. Click on the image.c) A new screen will show your Wifi network. Select your Wifi network. Enter and verify your Wifi password. Press 'Continue' in the top right hand corner of thescreen when finished. (When the password and verification match, then the 'Continue' button will turn green.) Please keep in mind that it may take severalseconds to save the password.d) Once the camera's blinking pattern changes to GREEN, you will be prompted to leave the Stem app, and return to your settings on your iOS device andswitch back to your own Wifi network.e) Return to the Stem app and press `Continue' in the top right corner. A picture of the camera view will appear and the camera will start the registering processby going through the following checklist (please note that this step could take up to 30 minutes):✔ Establish Connection With Camera✔ Gather Information From Camera✔ Establish Server Connections✔ Verify All Connections✔ Final Configuration✔ Final Registrationf) Once the camera has gone through the registration checklist, a `Success' message will appear. Press `OK'.Your camera is now ready for use! Tap on the image of the camera for `live streaming' mode and to start enjoying your IZON VIEW!Please let us know if you need any further assistance."_____If I had to do this all over again, I would only do the manual install - the other was a complete waste of time.  I wouldn't rely on this to watch over an elderly patient or monitor a baby's room - as I think it's a hit and miss product and a bit pricey to not be reliable.

Reviews.Title: Cloud space and motion detection
Reviews.Author: Johw89joh
Reviews.Content: Over the last few days I've tried using and placing in different areas the Izon camera. The camera is an incredible idea in theory, unfortunately it doesn't work the way I would hope. Whenever Night Vision turns on in the evening, the camera starts to record 30 second clips every 2 minutes. These clips are supposed to record whenever the camera senses movement. (Also these clips begin recording every two minutes with the sensitivity meter turned all the way down.) Unfortunately there is a limit of 25 videos per day, and since they are recording faithfully every two minutes, it fills up after an hour or so. Afterwards it takes screenshots every two minutes until dawn. This defeats the purpose of getting an alert that there is movement when I'm away from my home.I bought the camera in preparation of a vacation to watch my pets, but due to its inability to detect motion successfully, my quota of videos are taken up within the first hour of the 24 hours in a day. What's the point of having it?Considering that this was a "user error" I changed where the camera detects motion, the motion sensitivity, and I've place the camera in three different locations- no success. When I called tech support I was told to unplug it and plug it back in, then after a long silence, I got no further advice apart from an "I'm sorry" when it didn't work. (Great customer service, I'd say!) The problem seems software related since I noticed the Night Vision seems to refresh every couple minutes as well. Just to be sure I wasn't crazy I checked my wireless connectivity and I'm streaming top notch.Another problem I've had is that though notifications are turned on in the app, and in my iPhone's settings, I can only see notifications when I open up the app and check them manually. I wish this would work the way I had hoped, but unless a type of update to fix the problem I'm having comes out, I'll have to return the 100.00+ Product, along with its' mediocre customer service.

Reviews.Title: can't share videos
Reviews.Author: BostonMerlin
Reviews.Content: this camera takes fine videos but you can not share those videos with anyone.  they're locked into the app.  WTF!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Super easy setup
Reviews.Author: J. Rice
Reviews.Content: We just got this and it took less than 5 minutes to get it up and running.  the picture quality is super clear.  we have it setup to look outside and there is a bit of glare on the image since the glass shows a reflection, but its not really a problem for viewing the image.  looking forward to seeing what happens in low light....follow up: night viewing is pretty good. better than i expected.  also should note that the images on my phone are about 5-10 seconds delayed from real time.  not sure if thats due to a slow wi-fi or the camera, but thought i would mention it in case real-time access is important to someone.

Reviews.Title: Inconsistent results
Reviews.Author: Richard J. Flynn
Reviews.Content: The monitor was very simple to install.  It worked well until they updated the software on the iPhone and iPad apps.  Now I get inconsistent results and sometimes get alerts that have no video.  Customer support is also unresponsive giving stock answers to every inquiry.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money.  Only regret is that you can't view the feed via a browser.
Reviews.Author: Greg and Samantha Collier
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Easy to set up.  Magnetic base.  Inexpensive.  Free uploads (up to 99) online.cons:  No battery power alternative.  Can't view via desktop OS's.  Can't share feeds.

Reviews.Title: Wish it worked better than it does.
Reviews.Author: Marcia Elkins
Reviews.Content: I purchased this a week ago and it is going back tomorrow.  Fairly easy to set up.  It didn't work the first time, but did the second.  The first night I'd recorded my cat snoring so much I used up my 25 events per 24 hr period. Yes there is a limit and no way to increase that.It didn't pick up a lot of things like us coming into the living room each morning.  And then when it did, the alerts wouldn't have any video attached so you wouldn't know what set it off.  Sometimes the video would appear hours later and sometimes not.So, although it was somewhat easy to set up, I can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: The product didn't work at all.
Reviews.Author: Anton Meick
Reviews.Content: I was told that I have an old version of the product from izon customer support that isn't going to work nor that they currently support.They have been kind enough to offer to replace it but not without some work on my part. Curious if the new items will even work. Not assured that it will.When I buy a product from amazon I expect it to work when I receive it.Totally disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Not quite ready for prime time
Reviews.Author: Joel C. Hart
Reviews.Content: I own two of these cameras, one is in Texas and one is in Mexico. The software has been updated several times and some improvements have been made. It's a very easy set-up and operation.My two cameras work, only one records and sends alerts. After many e mails bad attempts to fix the camera the MELE crew at I-Zon finally told me to unplug the camera and re-boot the system. Unfortunately the camera is 1000 miles away.If you are close to the location of your cameras , buy the system. It does work. If your camera is at your beach house 1000 miles away beware.... The customer service is good and they reply to emails fairly quickly. But they know they have software problems. I believe they will get them fixed. Mean time I will fly to Mexico next week and reboot the camera and install a second system.

Reviews.Title: Useful and fun
Reviews.Author: Steven Rakers
Reviews.Content: I already have several of these, and in addition to being useful to see our pets, it is just a lot of fun to open the APP and see what's going on.

Reviews.Title: Worthless!
Reviews.Author: Scott Hudgens
Reviews.Content: Multiple Failed setup attempts with the barcode and then manual process.  I was never was able to get it on our Home Wifi.  Terrible product website, terrible support.  If i could give it 0 stars I would.

Reviews.Title: Problems
Reviews.Author: L. Gabella "Luca"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these cameras. While one of them gave me problems but eventually sorted itself out (don't ask me how) the second one stopped working all of the sudden. I must say I had great support from the customer service, but no way I was able to have the second camera working. It is a nice tool, but I think it's definitely not worth the price and not completely reliable.

Reviews.Title: Works sometimes
Reviews.Author: Wayne
Reviews.Content: Easy hookup, easy connection (make sure you have your Wi-Fi password), good view, easy to change settings and a small size. The problem is that I have it set to detect motion and I have changed the sensitivity several times to get it to record when something moves, SOMETIMES it works and SOMETIMES it does not. Sometimes when you open the door and NOT walk in it records. Then an hour later you open the door and walk in and it does not record. Nice device but needs some work. The only time you can be sure of the device is if you set there and watch it continuously, you have to reset the app every 5 minute (that is no big deal).

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: R. H Lepine "peterpump"
Reviews.Content: Caution, if you cannot memorize a whole series of color codes, based on two colors, whether there blinking fast or slow, whether they're double blinking or single blinking, blinking the same color or alternating, then you'd better think twice before buying these.BTW, nowhere on their support pages or in their instruction book do they give a list of these codes.I have wasted hours trying to get these two cameras to work.  Sometimes one works, then you do the same to the next, and it doesn't.They might have good customer support, but I have a day job and a family to care for.  So at the time

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: P. Nelson "AV Lady"
Reviews.Content: It found my home network immediately and began working WITH NO PROBLEM. I can't understand why people have such a problem with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Needs a little more WiFi range...
Reviews.Author: Timothy Wernicke
Reviews.Content: This unit was easy to setup and get working.  Took me ~ (10) minutes for everything.  The only issue that I had was that it started to drop from the network frequently.  After contacting support they told me that it does not have a WiFi amplifier like some other WiFi devices might.  So, I moved it about (10) feet closer to my router and now it has been solid.It would also be nice if they did not have the (25) video per day capture limit.  Sometimes it is unavoidable that more get captured while you're away and then you might miss the video that you really need.  If they were to provide an option to pay a small monthly fee for additional storage that would be OK too.Overall I am happy with this device since it is WiFi, easy to setup and provides very clear video to my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Better resolution than Foscam
Reviews.Author: MInDel
Reviews.Content: Pros: easy set up,  great iPhone app, motions and sound sensors work excellent, alarms and videos are great- resolution much better than foscam-Cons: doesn't move remotely,

Reviews.Title: Be patient with this!
Reviews.Author: David Schuh
Reviews.Content: Great product but not simple to install as advertised. Set aside at least an hour and have lots of patience. Once it's set up, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: Nice shape but Very poor support
Reviews.Author: augusto vinciguerra
Reviews.Content: It is sad too say that support is very poor and even the first steps to install the tool is very poor and does not work well at all.I suggest you to see different products than this;it is very poor.

Reviews.Title: difficult to install and configure
Reviews.Author: Carolina L. Rojas
Reviews.Content: we did not like this product bought it and still trying to configure and we can not. the camera front light does not blink and the caera does mot reset. we have tried more than 10 times legt the camera for a while disconnected and after connecting pressed reset button more than 20sexs still nothing? we want to return and full refund for both camera. please contact by email.

Reviews.Title: Video started out looking great.... but after a week or so...
Reviews.Author: Eric J. Willden
Reviews.Content: I chose this item due to it's simplicity, design, and compactness.  It was relatively easy to setup and get going.Like:  Small, out of the way.  No required internet cable to set it up.Dislike: The video/picture the first week or so, was great!  Now, every time I pull up the video feed on my iPhone, it looks more grainy, less sharp, and the colors of the room seem... faded.  I think I may need to call the manufacture and get it replaced.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: If you want a cam that you can depend on, this is NOT the one.  Totally unreliable.  Remote access is pitiful.  I have VueZone, and Dropcam, both of which far exceed  the izon,  in both  hardware and software (iPhone app),  I have had the izon for about a year and what prompted me to write this review now is to maybe help someone avoid the same frustration with this product that I have experienced.  Perhaps Stem will get the hint that either a good firmware or hardware update is in order.  Just now tried to access both my izons and, as usual, it wouldn't come up.  Beware.

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money
Reviews.Author: PeggyB "maggie'smum"
Reviews.Content: I've had it for a year and before they had firmware problems it used to work pretty good.  Since they "fixed" it, there is a 3 to 5 second delay in the video feed which didn't used to happen.  Someone could walk across the room and the camera would not see them unless they stood still for a couple of seconds.  I called customer support and got blown off.  Terrible camera and worst customer service.

Reviews.Title: Junk...it doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Kim R Hampton
Reviews.Content: Bought it from the Apple Store.I can't get it to work.Working with support now but I think I'll be taking it back to the store to get my money back.After purchase and not able to get it to work I started reading reviews from other sites.  Overall this is a poor unit.Don't buy.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CONCEPT WITH SEVERE LIMITATIONS
Reviews.Author: Amitha Omonuwa
Reviews.Content: I try not to give poor reviews but I was so disappointed with this device that I was compelled to share my experience.For starters, I had no issues with the setup. I followed the instructions and to works well on my wifi network. I had been looking for a camera that was ios compatible so I think the technology is amazing. However, it's poorly executed.I have two major issues with this device: First, It will only record 30-second clips and theres a limit to how many clips you can record and store for the life of the device. I imagine that they have these limits to save space on their cloud.That brings me to the second and worse issue. There is no way to download any recordings from the izon cloud unto your iDevice. I find that ridiculous! They would save so much cloud space if users could download their own videos off the site.The video quality is not great but tolerable. This device would have been so much more if the user had more control over the length of the length of the recordings and the ability to download recorded videos. Buyer beware

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Heather McClellan
Reviews.Content: Works great for my application.  I use it in my daycare to see and hear the kids in the other room when making lunch.

Reviews.Title: Stem video monitor
Reviews.Author: Marianthi Koritsaris
Reviews.Content: I bought this to keep an eye on my dog, who has separation anxiety.  It takes a long time to load and often freezes.

Reviews.Title: Basic home monitoring
Reviews.Author: Lisa Littlefield
Reviews.Content: I bought this for just a bit of security. I didn't feel the need for a fancy expensive system. It was easy to set up, but there is no manual really explaining features. When the IZON had an issue customer support was not helpful/reachable. We sent an email and waited several days for a "canned response" that didn't really answer our question. Other than that, it really works well.

Reviews.Title: bad support
Reviews.Author: E. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I returned these because this newest version doesn't support wifi networks that have symbols in the network name and password field. Their support team was unhelpful in providing any estimate as to when they might have a fix in their firmware like they'd done for the 1st gen camera.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good buy but will seek alternatives in the future
Reviews.Author: Morgan
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these about a month ago but can only set one up! It will also turn off on occasion and I am unable to use it for the rest of the day until I get home to fix it. I thought the customer service team was great but I wish it worked the first time and as advertised...

Reviews.Title: Terrible Camera
Reviews.Author: Justin Guthrie
Reviews.Content: Horribly product, I would not recommend to anyone.  Picture is terrible and the connection is unreliable even in the next room.

Reviews.Title: poor product
Reviews.Author: toto
Reviews.Content: The camera works, but the video quality is badThe software sucks:- login to user account takes sometimes hours or fails- watching recorded videos takes terrible long time or fails- downloading or sharing recorded videos is not possible.I deeply regret that I bought this rubbish and overpriced camera with a terrible retarded softwareThere are so many other cameras on the market doing the same but much better.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy they don't work, total junk.
Reviews.Author: Danny Wilson
Reviews.Content: The camera works via your wifi modem, you sign up on a webpage and put your phone in and you get a text with a barcode that you place in front of the ozone camera. After this you spend hours trying to get this to recognise the barcode so it hooks in to your modem. Nothing happens and you don't know what is going on as there is no trouble shooting or advice on what to do. On the webpage there is a number you call but its disconnected. I than emailed and a day later received an response asking me to take a snap shop of the error on the screen, done this 1 week later and 2 more emails no answer. The setup on this system is far too complicated and there is just no support if it don't work. Save your money and look elsewhere, this is just complicated junk.

Reviews.Title: Not a Fan of IZONs
Reviews.Author: Herb.R.
Reviews.Content: I've had this product for a couple years, initially started with one, then added a couple more. I'd say that over this time, I've contacted their customer support 10+ times regarding issues. All-in-all, I've become disenchanted by the product and the company behind it.What I've experienced: an inconsistent delivery. They sometimes stop working, need to be reset or restated. The iphone app has been buggy and still is. It's become more a frustration then a benefit and I will be decommissioning these units after multiple issues where they do not work as intended.

Reviews.Title: Installing is very difficult.
Reviews.Author: Arch
Reviews.Content: I am having difficulties with this product since i bought it, i can't connect it with my OS devices, i fails to establish connection with server.Don't recommend.

Reviews.Title: inconsistant performance 2.0 vs 1.0
Reviews.Author: yypizza
Reviews.Content: I bought 1.0 version 2years ago, the performance is ok only, not impressive, sometimes it is off netowrk, need to reset all the time (turn off and then on almost twice per week). We need more to monitor different area and my husband being lazy to investigate other brand's product so we ordered the 2.0 version and hope there is some improvement. We've having two izons (1.0 and 2.0) set up in the same room to compare for 2 weeks, only difference is the clearness of the screen, 2.0 is much clear. However, I found the stability of performance of 2.0 is worse than 1.0We saw image on 1.0 but 2.0 show nothing... it completely stop working and reloading all the time..... so it is really frustrated if you need to monitor baby or elderly people. and Yes, if you set up motion sensor for recording, sometimes it give alert without image or recording...so what is the use?

Reviews.Title: Did not work on my iPhone as expected
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Did not work on my iPhone as expected. I was not able to access videos, even though I had not yet reached the limit for the day.

Reviews.Title: Trouble with older models
Reviews.Author: Tom Atera
Reviews.Content: If you have an older model that is 8-12 months old contact stem if your having trouble. Mine was having all sorts of trouble connecting to the network. Firmware upgrades didn't help.  They will probably replace it like they did mine. The seller would not help, just the manufacturer Stem.Stem was great about this and are supplying a newer model.  When buying the latest You should get the Izon 2.0. Or the one with night vision called Izon View and avoid the prior models which are still sold.[...]

Reviews.Title: Far inferior in every way to dropcam
Reviews.Author: Julio Estrada
Reviews.Content: Only works with iproducts, no webWorse video qualityMore difficult setupMore expensiveBetter nigh visionGo with dropcam

Reviews.Title: Great Product, easy setup, very convenient
Reviews.Author: Jason Ensminger
Reviews.Content: These are great little cameras that you can monitor using your iPhone.  Setup is super easy and they are have very versatile mounting options.  You can monitor what's going on from anywhere in the world that you can connect to the internet, which was great for me when I travel.  I'm very happy with my iZon and will be adding more of these cameras around my home.  I highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: Not able to set up
Reviews.Author: Eric Jacobson
Reviews.Content: bad news , will not set up. No customer service...no returned calls Nothing....RETUREND and done...  After 5 calls they never called me  back, they don't card!!)In a word ....terrable

Reviews.Title: Good luck figuring out remote viewing....
Reviews.Author: Gun Guru
Reviews.Content: Sets up very quick and easy if using your home wifi network.The problem comes in when you try and view remotely. The product states you can view from anywhere, but it does not appear it is live streaming.You set it up to record on motion, and you can view the videos, at least that is the best I can figure out.I was not able to figure out how ti use remotely, and that is the only reason I purchased this, to watch my home from work.I called customer service during regular business hours and got a message stating no one was available, so I left a message for a return call and never got a call back.If you are looking to use this only on your wifi network, it should work out for you.If you are buying it for the same reason I was, remote viewing, either live or of the recorded video, I would say do not buy this item.Go to the web page and read the instructions before buying, I could not even find the issue addressed in their .pdf manual.I am returning to Amazon today.

Reviews.Title: Crapy camara
Reviews.Author: Moe Mneimneh
Reviews.Content: don't bother to buy this camara, i have already did and i am very unhappy with it, they still need to work alot on it, the only star that i gave them because of the idea being monitor wirelessly rather than that crappppppppp

Reviews.Title: Works well for me!
Reviews.Author: craig s
Reviews.Content: I set this camera up in about 10 minutes,it does the job for me pretty well,I will eventually get more to create a system.

Reviews.Title: Very good to monitor home remotely
Reviews.Author: Vincent A. Pizzica "VinceP"
Reviews.Content: But a bit complex on the first set up. After that great and I find the remote sound monitor good too.

Reviews.Title: Easiest home monitoring camera ever
Reviews.Author: Christopher Brandon
Reviews.Content: This little device is amazing! I used to have a Linksys WVC80N home monitoring camera that was a huge pain. You practically needed to be a sysadmin to figure out how to connect it to your home network. And if you wanted to view it online, you had to purchase web hosting from some three-bit company that Linksys partnered with.I got the Izon Stem setup on my network in less than 5 minutes. And it runs thru an app on my iphone... I thought for sure they were going to charge me to use the app, but it's entirely free! You can only view the video on the iphone you have it connected to (NO viewing on a desktop), but that's not a problem for me. The app may be a drain on battery life, but I haven't used it enough yet to find out if that's true.

Reviews.Title: Best choice for simple, reliable home security IP camera
Reviews.Author: Mac_Cat "MacIntosh Man"
Reviews.Content: Amazingly well designed product (2.0 version)Fast setup and a simple smartphone STEM app.Customer Support via email works smoothly.I got a reply, on Sunday, within 30 minutes.I logged on to their web site to write-up my concern andthen to close out the ticket, once I figured out what was wrong at my end.I was working with a Foscam FI9821W Indoor Pan/Tilt H.264 720p Wireless IP Camera, which took me much longer to figure out and setup.  While it had a similar quality picture, the Foscam has a terrible manual and worse, it just goes away with no explanation.Pros:1) Small2) Simple3) Reliable4) Easy to configure (but slow)Cons:1) no pan / tilt option2) no browser interface for your computer3) limited settings for motion alarm mode4) Slow configuration processRating:  I'm pleased enough to buy several moreUPDATE:October 2013 (5 months later)I'm still very pleased with these cameras.  I bought more.They continue to operate with no further intervention.I can turn the SOUND or MOTION detection on or off from my iPhone anytime.They give me great sense of peace, knowing everything is OK at home when I'm away.I don't own the WiFi Router in my house - it's a cable company box.I was looking for some kind of camera that did not require me to open ports or do any kind of network configuration and this is the right camera for that reason.It is simple, reliable, and easy to move around to anywhere in the house.The app has updated since I bought it, and while it required me to log in again, that was the only glitch.  The new app interface is better in many ways, but the server gets tied up at times.  So, I have learned to just check back a little later and usually, it's able to download the images to my phone.It's not perfect and the only reason they get 4 stars instead of 5 is the app, not the actual camera!I'm buying more and sending them to everyone in my family who has an iPhone.Cheers !!!Jan 2014 report (7 months later)Make sure you have updated your STEM app.Just before vacation, my iPhone alerted me to check my cameras.  They had a new image, but I could not download it.  Then I noticed my cameras were offline and a text message was on top of the video window.  It turns out that my WiFi router was broken.  The internet, TV and phones still worked, but the wireless was coming up and going away every other minute!  (If the cameras dropped off the wireless network, there is no way then can send a video clip.  There may be an alert, but don't expect any video to download)I replaced the router and then I added each existing camera again.  During that process, the STEM APP ask for the WiFi network password (it changes when you get a new router).  After that, two information screens came up, I clicked OK each time and then a QR image (the large square with a random pattern of black and white boxes) appeared.  It is the WiFi network password in a digital format that the camera can read.  There are 3 steps listed at the bottom,  so read them and be prepared to wait a few minutes.  This login and configuration process is very slow, but it does work!1) Each camera reads the QR code.  It blinks green (twice) and orange (twice) connecting to the WiFi (logon/password)Durring this process, made sure the code is visible and that a message hasn't covered it up.  You may have to click OK a couple times.2) Finally, the camera will change to a solid orange color.  (connected to the internet)3) The app instructions tell you not to do anything until the IZON camera led turns green.  Well, it won't unless you allow the STEM app to complete the registration process, which takes about 5-10 minutes!!!  You will probably have to say OK to a couple of notices and then a menu comes with a checklist of what it's doing.  Just wait.  It's very slow, but it will work !!!The lesson here was that the app alerted me that the cameras had each been triggered, and while they said the network was down, I couldn't figure that out, since my cell phone was still work (albeit on the cell network, not my home network).  Your router can be working and making internet connections, while the wireless part is down.  I didn't expect that.I figured out that the new app will not allow you to Delete an existing camera.  But,  you can add a camera and it will replace the one you had before (not much different than adding a printer to a computer).NOTE: Wireless devices can get pretty warm when they can't connect to their router.  It might even over-heat.  So, consider unplugging the camera and letting it cool down, if it has been off-line a long time.  The STEM app instructions are correct and they do work.
